property.global_description:
Lodge House Vintage Cabin - Pool Table - Walk to Lake - Summertime Pool

Originally Potters Camp, a vintage fisherman's retreat in the early 1900s, our historic lakefront lodge is over a hundred years old yet still caters to mountain visitors looking to enjoy the tranquil waters of Big Bear Lake. Catering to all types of vacationers seeking a unique mountain experience, this rustic yet spacious lakefront property offers the perfect recipe for relaxation and unwinding, from couples and families to large groups for gatherings and special events, this property is perfect for everyone. Managed by Big Bear Vacations, this historic site boasts twelve mountain-style cabins on two acres of pine-shaded lakefront property including direct lake access, a summertime boat dock, playground, and swimming pool.

Lodge House is the original office of this culture-rich property, boasting original wood walls and mountain charm paired with nostalgic vibes and a true rock fireplace where you can enjoy warming your toes together as a family or watching a movie on the flat screen Streaming TV. A full kitchen and dining area sit at the back of the cabin, perfect for preparing home cooked meals and snacks for the day's adventures. The back patio offers additional dining options and a Charcoal BBQ for you to grill up your freshly caught dinner from the lake. The spacious living room pairs perfectly with the open game room to provide plenty of space for memories to be made here in the mountains, the French doors from here lead out to the spacious sun deck complete with patio furnishings and a great view of the summertime pool.

Three spacious bedrooms including the primary suite and private bath are easily accessible within this single level rustic retreat, with private access doors to both guest rooms this is the perfect setup for a group of friends or family vacation to the mountains. Step outside to enjoy this spacious lakefront lodge property, complete with a spacious group dining area, kids' playground, summertime pool, and the spacious lake shore area with boat dock access for guests. Located just a short walk to Big Bear Village and local marinas this truly is an unbeatable location no matter the season you choose to visit!

Big Bear Gambrel is set high above the road so you must be able to climb stairs to get inside and is a three-story home. On the main level of the cabin, you'll find floor-to-ceiling windows in the living room with a large wood-burning fireplace, 40" smart tv (Netflix, Hula, Amazon), and an extra large comfy sectional. The dining room consists of a custom 9 person farmhouse table and bench, perfect and roomy for your family and friends to enjoy a meal. You'll also find the kitchen on this level, stocked with all the pots, pans, and any cooking items you'll need during your stay in addition to updated appliances. The kitchen comes equipped with a Keurig and a regular coffee machine. There is also a propane grill on the back deck available for use. Also, the house is equipped with Rabbit Air purifiers on each floor.

You can find one full bathroom on the main level with a tiled tub and shower and a bathroom with a shower on the lowest level. This cabin may have been built in 1970 but all of the upgrades and renovations mean plenty of hot water and great water pressure for all the guests. Off of the main floor, there is a large wrap-around deck around the home with a custom wood table and umbrella, outdoor furniture, including a fire pit, and lounge seating for many on the front and back sides where you can watch the shooting stars. (It's my favorite spot for morning coffee.) If you look up you can see the ski resort and since we are sitting high on the street, you won't be looking into neighbors' windows, but instead, you'll have a perfect view of trees, mountains, and the slopes. Upstairs you'll find both bedrooms. The master bedroom is a loft and overlooks the living room. It has the most amazing view of the trees and mountains. If you tire of the view, there is a 40" smart tv and retro malm wood-burning fireplace to keep you warm and toasty if you're visiting in the winter. The guest bedroom has a queen-sized bed and two twin bunk beds. There is a private balcony attached to this room. The backyard is woodsy and quiet so this is the perfect place for an afternoon nap or to read a book and relax.

Downstairs is where all the fun happens! There is a full-sized pool table, a poker/chess/card table, electronic dartboard game, and is fully stocked with board games and puzzles! There is also a Super-Sac LoveSac and Love-Sac Moonpit Lounger. The lounger is the size of 2 queen size beds and easily sleeps 4 adults. There is also a 120" projection screen with surround sound for the perfect movie night! We also have a Nintendo Classic and the projection screen is equipped with Apple TV. On the deck, there is a 6 person hot tub (cleaned weekly) with gorgeous ski slope and mountain views. Additionally, you can find 2 twin air mattresses to use on this level or upstairs in the main living room, whatever fits your sleeping arrangements. This is great for adults and kids alike!

There is also a second full bath on this level with a large walk-in shower. This is where you can find the washer and dryer and anything you need to do laundry. All carpets, upholstery, area rugs, and mattresses are cleaned regularly. There are several speakers throughout the cabin equipped with Amazon Music. Many of the lights are controlled and the home is Nest thermostat controlled. There is also high-speed WIFI through the house.

**New Addition** In the backyard, with a giant 7.5' window facing the woods, you'll find 100 square feet of triangle perfection. With just enough room for a king-sized bed, this is the perfect spot to nap, read a book, stargaze or watch the snowfall. The driveway can accommodate a maximum of 3 vehicles. If you have a large truck or SUV, there may only be room for 2. There is no street parking.

Please be aware that during winter months, chains and/or 4WD are often required to enter Big Bear. During the snowy months, the mountain is not safe to drive without them and the city does enforce these requirements. Our driveway is also on a slope, so if it is snowy, you will need chains or 4WD to park. If you have any questions about this, feel free to message us.

Guest access
You'll have access to the entire cabin minus a small owner's closet that is attached to the laundry room where we keep cleaning supplies, house and yard tools.

Other things to note
We have two bikes located on the property for guests to use. The street in front of the house is perfect for an afternoon bike ride or walk. These are cruiser bikes, not mountain bikes, and are perfect for the lake paths or roads.

There is a propane grill on the back deck available for guests' use.

The home is equipped with Ring cameras on the exterior of the home. This provides a safe environment for our guests and ensures that occupancy, pet policies are rules are followed

property.lock_box_directions:
To unlock the door and enter the home:

1. Enter the Access Code on the keypad. A green light will flash and indicate the code is accepted on the Schlage button. If the light flashes red, the code may have been entered incorrectly. Allow 5 seconds for the lock to reset and try again.
2. Rotate the deadbolt that is under the keypad AWAY from the door jam, unlocking the deadbolt.
3. Open the door using the door handle.

To lock the door:

1. Press the Schlage button on the keypad.
2. Rotate the deadbolt that is under the keypad TOWARD the door jam, engaging the deadbolt.
3. The door does NOT lock automatically, so please lock it when you leave.

Troubleshooting Steps:

A green light will flash and indicate the code is accepted on the Schlage button. If the light flashes red, the code may have been entered incorrectly. Allow 5 seconds for the lock to reset and try again. The lock will enter an inactive state for 30 seconds after entering the wrong code 3 times in a row. After the inactive time has passed, the next wrong code will make the lock enter another inactive state for another 30 seconds.

[Video Guide](https://player.vimeo.com/video/783928079)
